DOC.HEAD: Six Skiers Die in Giant Snowslide in Western Switzerland
DOC.TEXT: A huge avalanche struck southwestern Switzerland and killed six Swiss skiers, rescue officials said Saturday. The avalanche was 1,000 feet wide and hit the Mt. Simplon region Friday. The victims were five youths and a guide who were on a two-day tour in the region. Searchers in a helicopter found their bodies. Officials said two of the youths apparently had been able to free themselves from the masses of snow but then died of exposure and exhaustion.
